intro: Pouzolzia fadenii, commonly known as the African rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in arid and rocky environments. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to yellow. It has a low-growing, mat-forming habit with succulent, fleshy leaves. Pouzolzia fadenii is often used in rock gardens due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
